{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient experienced muscular symptoms after starting rosuvastatin, which resolved after stopping the medication. This suggests a possible adverse reaction to rosuvastatin. The next best course of action would be to consider an alternative lipid-lowering therapy. Options include initiating a different statin or initiating fenofibrate. Fish oils are not typically used as first-line therapy for LDL control. Restarting rosuvastatin at a lower dose may still result in the recurrence of muscular symptoms. Therefore, the best choice would be to initiate a different statin or fenofibrate.", "answer_choice": "C"}
